Judul: THERMAL BEHAVIOUR AND THE COMBUSTION KINETICS OF HYBRID COALS BASED ON ITS THERMOGRAVIMETRIC ANALYSIS
Abstrak:
In 2019, Indonesia produced 616 Mt of coal. However, most of the coal types in Indonesia
consists of lower rank coal which, when burned produces a large amount of carbon
dioxide and produces less energy compared to higher rank coal. Hybrid coal technology
aims to upgrade these lower rank coals and reduce the CO2 emissions. This because the
amount of carbon absorbed by the biomass during its growth is equal to the carbon
produced during its combustion hence what is known as a carbon neutral combustion.
Co-combustion is one of the technological options for coal-biomass blends to produce
heat. The design and adaptation of the technology used for co-combustion of hybrid coal
is required and an understanding of the phenomena involved the stages of the thermal
events.
Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) is used to determine the thermal behavior of the
hybrid coal. This method is widely used in the industry due to it being simple and
relatively cheap. Thermogravimetry (TG) and derivative thermogravimetry (DTG) curves
are the results of thermogravimetric analysis. Both curves represents the weight loss and
weight loss rates as a function of time and temperature of the hybrid coal. Isoconversional
method (model-free) and model-fitting methods are used to determine the
kinetic parameters such as, activation energy (Ea) and pre-exponential factor (A). On the
other hand, the decomposition process of biomass and coal are influenced by its
macromolecular structure. The stages of the decomposition are divided into two or three
steps depends on the heating rate and the mix used. Biomass used in this sample are
rubberwood and pinewood. Meanwhile the low rank coal used are lignite and subbituminous.
The results based on the model-free approach, samples contain lignite has an
Ea value between 57.25-310.98 kJ/mol, whereas the mixture of sub-bituminous has an Ea
value range of 40.67-226.86 kJ/mol. It is indicated the hybrid coal has suitable for the
combustion process.
